meta.description: Recorded statements that expose persistent human behavior, contradiction, and limitation, often without intent to do so.
meta.intent: To preserve concise observations of human and systemic behavior without interpretation or moral framing.
rules: Context is optional, interpretation is not enforced

entries.author: Samuel Beckett
entries.quote: Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try again. Fail again. Fail better.

entries.author: Paulo Coelho
entries.quote: You will never be able to escape from your heart. So it is better to listen to what it has to say.

entries.author: George Orwell
entries.quote: In a time of deceit, telling the truth is a revolutionary act.

entries.author: Boethius
entries.quote: In every adversity of fortune, the most unhappy kind of misfortune is to have been happy.

entries.author: Kurt GÃ¶del
entries.quote: Either mathematics is too big for the human mind or the human mind is more than a machine.

entries.author: William of Ockham
entries.quote: Entities should not be multiplied without necessity.

entries.author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb
entries.quote: Systems that rely on prediction eventually fail; systems that benefit from disorder survive.

entries.author: Richard Feynman
entries.quote: For a successful technology, reality must take precedence over public relations, for nature cannot be fooled.

entries.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
entries.quote: He who fights with monsters should look to it that he himself does not become a monster.

entries.author: Hannah Arendt
entries.quote: The sad truth is that most evil is done by people who never make up their minds to be good or evil.

entries.author: Alan Turing
entries.quote: We can only see a short distance ahead, but we can see plenty there that needs to be done.

entries.author: Albert Camus
entries.quote: The struggle itself is enough to fill a man's heart.
